intro: Calysaccion obovale, commonly known as the narrow-lobed calysaccion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, ovate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to dry conditions. Calysaccion obovale is often found in open areas with well-drained soils.
